intro: Eriolobus kansuensis, commonly known as the Kansu spurge, is a perennial herb native to the arid regions of China. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It is adapted to survive in dry, rocky environments, often growing in mountainous areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
